You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Set Up the Entitled Strategy for Effective Accounts

Grant access for a contact to shop on behalf of all accounts that are shared with the contact's account, regardless of account group or hierarchy. To specify the criteria you want to use for granting access to other accounts, create a sharing set. Also, set up the appropriate accounts and update the appropriate storefront configuration settings.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
Edit account details	Edit on Accounts
Create a sharing set	Customize Application
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
TIP A sharing set is limited to one condition per object per Experience Cloud site, and you can't use AND or OR operators that evaluate multiple conditions.

For example, maybe a contact from a separate Executive account can purchase on behalf of multiple accounts across different account hierarchies and account groups. You can allow the contact to log in to the storefront on behalf of any account their sharing set allows. The contact can:

View products entitled to the selected account
See prices entitled to the selected account
Check out using the selected account's billing and shipping address

To implement the entitled strategy for effective accounts:

Enable Allow users to relate a contact to multiple accounts in your org's account settings. Complete the steps in Set Up Contacts to Multiple Accounts .
Set up the primary account that can access other effective accounts, such as the Executive account.
On the Accounts tab in your org, edit the record for the primary account.
Assign the account to an account group—such as Executive Account Group. Make sure to assign a price list—such as Executive Price List—to that account group.
In the Contacts related list, add the account's primary contact (who's going to purchase on behalf of other effective accounts).
Update the primary contact with the related effective accounts that you want to allow the contact to access.
On the Contacts tab in your org, find the record for the primary contact.
In the Related Accounts related list, add all the accounts that you want to allow the contact to access.
Create a sharing set so that an account's primary contact can access data for the contact's other related accounts.
NOTE Account data is secure by default: the organization-wide default (OWD) external access for account records is Private. To allow buyers to access data from other accounts, create a sharing set that applies to users with your storefront's user profile. You created this profile before you installed the managed package.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Scroll to the Sharing Sets related list, and click New.
Enter and a label and name for the sharing set, such as Effective Account Sharing Set.
In the Select Profiles section, select your custom storefront user profile and add it to the Selected Profiles list.
In the Select Objects section, add Account to the Selected Objects list.
In the Configure Access section, click Set Up in the Action column for the account object.
In the Access Mapping for Account window, select the following values, and click Update.
FIELD	VALUE
Grant access where: User	Contact.RelatedAccount
Matches: Target Account	Id
Matches: Access Level	Read Only
NOTE This sharing set specifies that an account's primary contact can access the data of any account included in the contact's Related Accounts related list. The access level is Read Only because the user is only referencing data from the effective account, and isn't modifying any account details.
Click Save.
Update your storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Effective Account (3).
Find the Filter Mode configuration (4), and check its value (5).
TIP
If the configuration has a value other than Entitled, click Override in the Action column. Enter a Entitled for Value, and click Create. But, use caution when you override an existing value for this configuration—your org could already be set up to use a different effective accounts strategy.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Effective Account
Configuration	Filter Mode
Page	all
Value	Entitled
Enable the Effective Account Selector for your storefront, and choose the selector's display mode.
Set the value of the Assign Account configuration of the Effective Account module to OnlyEmpty or Never.
NOTE If this configuration's value is Always and you're using the entitled strategy, the Effective Account Selector lists the contact's primary account twice.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

To validate that your effective account strategy is working correctly, you can:

Browse the storefront and verify a selected effective account's entitled products and prices.
Navigate to the My Account page, which can show the addresses, carts, subscriptions, and more for the selected effective account.
TIP Are you using the entitled strategy and you allow customer service representatives (CSRs) to log in on behalf of buyers? Extend the ccrz.cc_hk_EffectiveAccount.fetchAccounts() method of the B2B Commerce API so that you're returning the correct accounts for the contact that the CSR is logged in as.
SEE ALSO
Create an Account Group
Create a Price List
Allow a Customer Service Representative to Log In to a Storefront on Behalf of a Buyer
Include the Buyer's Assigned Account in the Effective Account Selector

title: Setting up Effective Account Strategy for B2B Commerce
